title: Parametric Functions - path of thrown ball

content.question: A ball is thrown from a starting point at time <math alttext="t equals 0"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> seconds. The horizontal distance, in feet, of the ball from the starting point is given by <math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses equals 23.5 t"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>23.5</mn><mi>t</mi></math>. The vertical distance, in feet, of the ball from the ground is given by <math alttext="y open parentheses t close parentheses equals negative 16 t squared plus 46.9 t plus 6"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>16</mn><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>46.9</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn></math>. How many feet does the ball travel horizontally before it hits the ground?

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Apply numerical results in a given mathematical or applied context.
